alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 05 at 2:26PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN RETURNS FOR SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY... A quick moving moisture-laden front will move into the panhandle Saturday evening. 1 to 3 inches of rain are expected near sea level over the next 48 hours. Higher rain amounts are possible on windward slopes of the terrain. Snow levels are expected to rise from 2500 feet to 4000 feet. Increased runoff from rainfall and snowmelt will produce rises along small streams. Some streams may approach bankfull levels but no flooding is expected at this time. In regions with a larger snow pack near sea level, blocked drainages and ditches may lead to ponding of waters on or near roads.
